intro: Phyllorkis hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Hildebrandt's flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
